title: Aftertop 600W USB C Charging Station for Multiple Devices, 10 Ports PD3.1 140W PPS 45W QC60W Fast Charging Block for MacBook Pro Laptop, iPad, iPhone 16 15 Pro Max, Galaxy S24/S23 Ultra etc
description: Dual PD3.1 140W Super Speed: This multi ports USB C charging station equips 2x 140W PD3.1 ports for laptops, you can super fast charging for 2 MacBook Pro 16" M1/M2 with max 140W high speed at the same time, and it takes only 30 minutes to 50%, and 1.6 hours to fully charge.(To achieve 140W, you need the original cable for MacBook Pro 16'')
top_reviews:
[{"id":"R1SB187E883KFT","title":"Power station","body":"This is pretty much the strongest charging station I have for my family's devices. It is placed strategically so kids can park their tablets from school. It can hold 8 devices, 2 are wide enough for a small laptop and the rest for phones. It has 10 ports, 2 for USB-A and 8 are USB-C with 2 being PD 3.1 and can go up to 140W. As far as I know, only laptops uses 140W and it is great that it can handle it. It claims to deliver as much as 600W which is really almost all devices at the same time. I have not tried it but it does deliver PD level of power. This became our spot for charging anything, watches, phones, and is mostly plugged in all the time. It does not sleep as some stations will stop charging when it is full and does not resume. This is the perfect one unless you have a bigger need so this should be enough for a family. Read more","asin":"B0DKFCN7ZF","body_html":"
This is pretty much the strongest charging station I have for my family's devices. It is placed strategically so kids can park their tablets from school. It can hold 8 devices, 2 are wide enough for a small laptop and the rest for phones. It has 10 ports, 2 for USB-A and 8 are USB-C with 2 being PD 3.1 and can go up to 140W. As far as I know, only laptops uses 140W and it is great that it can handle it. It claims to deliver as much as 600W which is really almost all devices at the same time. I have not tried it but it does deliver PD level of power. This became our spot for charging anything, watches, phones, and is mostly plugged in all the time. It does not sleep as some stations will stop charging when it is full and does not resume. This is the perfect one unless you have a bigger need so this should be enough for a family.
Read more
","link":"https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/R1SB187E883KFT/ref=cm_cr_dp_d_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B0DKFCN7ZF","rating":5,"date":{"raw":"Reviewed in the United States on June 10, 2025","utc":"2025-06-10T00:00:00.000Z"},"profile":{"name":"Not a Scientist","link":"https://www.amazon.com/gp/profile/amzn1.account.AG7VFIGUYMRUFUYAB6DH2PQGVEMA/ref=cm_cr_dp_d_gw_tr?ie=UTF8","id":"AG7VFIGUYMRUFUYAB6DH2PQGVEMA"},"vine_program":true,"vine_program_free_product":true,"verified_purchase":false,"review_country":"us","is_global_review":false,"review_attributes":[{}]},{"id":"RFG0Y9LCQGKJW","title":"Easy to use, great charging and stand option for multiple devices","body":"Works great as both a stand and a multi device charger. Provides fast charging on a few ports for more power hungry devices like laptops and tablets and still provides fast charging to smaller devices too. Great overall size and footprint for use on a desk. Built well and it's nice that the power supply is built into the stand. Overall a really solid option if you have multiple laptops/tablets/phones/gaming devices/etc you want to charge all in one space. Read more","asin":"B0DKFCN7ZF","body_html":"
Works great as both a stand and a multi device charger. Provides fast charging on a few ports for more power hungry devices like laptops and tablets and still provides fast charging to smaller devices too. Great overall size and footprint for use on a desk. Built well and it's nice that the power supply is built into the stand. Overall a really solid option if you have multiple laptops/tablets/phones/gaming devices/etc you want to charge all in one space.

","link":"https://www.amazon.com/gp/customer-reviews/RFG0Y9LCQGKJW/ref=cm_cr_dp_d_rvw_ttl?ie=UTF8&ASIN=B0DKFCN7ZF","rating":5,"date":{"raw":"Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2025","utc":"2025-06-02T00:00:00.000Z"},"profile":{"name":"Dane","link":"https://www.amazon.com/gp/profile/amzn1.account.AE6HRTBFQNOSCSVS42TE7ABHUHYQ/ref=cm_cr_dp_d_gw_tr?ie=UTF8","id":"AE6HRTBFQNOSCSVS42TE7ABHUHYQ"},"vine_program":true,"vine_program_free_product":true,"verified_purchase":false,"review_country":"us","is_global_review":false,"review_attributes":[{}]},{"id":"R12G4M1MU2B6AR","title":"Up to 600 watts w/ fast-charging & fireproof housing, short-circuit & over-voltage protection","body":"I got a charging station, measuring 7 13/16” long, 5 1/16” deep, and 2 ¾” tall including the divider, or 1 ½” tall excluding the divider. I notice the dividers are not removable, and the nine dividers have varied distances between them. I see there are 8 rows to fit mobile devices, with the two rows in the center wide enough to fit multiple thin devices (at least two). I have a rubberized line on each side to prevent devices from slipping out, and I count 5 rubber feet - 1 on each corner and one in the very center. I find its power cord is about 58” long and two-pronged. When I plug it in, I see a small green light near the right front corner. I have two USB-A ports - one on the very left and one on the right - with 8 USB-C ports between them. The outputs vary between 20 up to 140 watts. The two USB-A ports can each deliver a maximum of 60 watts, I have two USB-C ports that each can deliver up to 20 watts, 2 USB-C ports that can deliver up to 45 watts, 2 USB-C ports that can deliver up to 65 watts, and two USB-C (PD 3.1) ports that each can deliver up to 140 watts. From what I understand in the manual, the charger can deliver up to 600 watts in total to 10 connected devices. According to the manual, the charger has short circuit protection and over-voltage protection, and it claims the plastic housing is made of fireproof material. I see it’s made in China and works with AC 100–240 volts, and it has RoHS, FCC, and CE certifications. My experience with charging is that not all devices are compatible, and I notice most of my tablets with USB-C charging ports just charge at around 10 or 11 watts according to the built-in energy meter in my charging cable. However, I can use it to charge my solar power generator at 60 watts, the maximum speed. I predict in the future I will have more devices that are compatible with fast charging to fully take advantage of this charging station. Read more","asin":"B0DKFCN7ZF","body_html":"
I got a charging station, measuring 7 13/16” long, 5 1/16” deep, and 2 ¾” tall including the divider, or 1 ½” tall excluding the divider. I notice the dividers are not removable, and the nine dividers have varied distances between them. I see there are 8 rows to fit mobile devices, with the two rows in the center wide enough to fit multiple thin devices (at least two). I have a rubberized line on each side to prevent devices from slipping out, and I count 5 rubber feet - 1 on each corner and one in the very center. I find its power cord is about 58” long and two-pronged. When I plug it in, I see a small green light near the right front corner. I have two USB-A ports - one on the very left and one on the right - with 8 USB-C ports between them. The outputs vary between 20 up to 140 watts. The two USB-A ports can each deliver a maximum of 60 watts, I have two USB-C ports that each can deliver up to 20 watts, 2 USB-C ports that can deliver up to 45 watts, 2 USB-C ports that can deliver up to 65 watts, and two USB-C (PD 3.1) ports that each can deliver up to 140 watts. From what I understand in the manual, the charger can deliver up to 600 watts in total to 10 connected devices. According to the manual, the charger has short circuit protection and over-voltage protection, and it claims the plastic housing is made of fireproof material. I see it’s made in China and works with AC 100–240 volts, and it has RoHS, FCC, and CE certifications. My experience with charging is that not all devices are compatible, and I notice most of my tablets with USB-C charging ports just charge at around 10 or 11 watts according to the built-in energy meter in my charging cable. However, I can use it to charge my solar power generator at 60 watts, the maximum speed. I predict in the future I will have more devices that are compatible with fast charging to fully take advantage of this charging station.
Read more

We have a console table that has been just cluttered with electronics. Now it is a clean and organized space that can charge everything. We routinely have two Chromebooks, two Android tablets, four Android phones, a battery bank, and a set of earbuds charging on this thing all at once. And even with all of those devices going at once everything is still able to charge at full speeds. The Chromebooks charge at 65w and the tablets at 45w while the phones can charge from 25w to 45w as well. This thing is amazing. I only wish it came with cables. Read more","asin":"B0DKFCN7ZF","body_html":"
I know it's cliche, but this thing is a game changer. We have a console table that has been just cluttered with electronics. Now it is a clean and organized space that can charge everything. We routinely have two Chromebooks, two Android tablets, four Android phones, a battery bank, and a set of earbuds charging on this thing all at once. And even with all of those devices going at once everything is still able to charge at full speeds. The Chromebooks charge at 65w and the tablets at 45w while the phones can charge from 25w to 45w as well. This thing is amazing. I only wish it came with cables.
